Two weeks after the terrorist attacks the American flag flies at fullstaff PERIOD Starbucks is pouring lattes PERIOD Barry Bonds is smacking homers PERIOD Prince William and Kathie Lee are tabloid headliners PERIOD

Same as it ever was Not quite PERIOD

 said Chicago psychiatrist Stevan Weine who counsels refugees from Bosnia PERIOD 

This unexpected vulnerability is  he said PERIOD 

The twentieth century pulsed with inspiring examples of how everyday people followed their habits and rituals in the face of overwhelming destruction or barbarism PERIOD

While it may appear futile psychologists say its a basic instinct to demonstrate that youre still standing however monstrous the circumstances PERIOD

During the London blitz housewives hung laundry to dry as bombs leveled their neighborhoods PERIOD

In genocidal Rwanda schoolteachers scratched the ABCs in the dirt for orphaned refuges PERIOD

In besieged Sarajevo women put on makeup to stand in bread lines PERIOD Couples dressed in evening attire to attend the symphony in a bombedout concert hall PERIOD A lone cellist played day after day in Sniper Alley exposed PERIOD

 psychiatrist Weine said PERIOD

The difference between then and now is that those acts of defiance occurred during long sieges when societies  and peoples minds  were smoldering ruins PERIOD

In this twenty-first century war on terrorism its early still PERIOD

Even Weine and other experts arent certain how people should behave or feel now PERIOD

So audacious and violent were the Sept PERIOD  attacks that claimed more than  lives that psychiatrists say lessons learned from conventional war natural disasters and other terrorist incidents such as the Oklahoma City bombing do not neatly apply PERIOD

Complicating matters is the persistent dread of more violence when and where uncertain PERIOD Feeling safe both as a nation and personally has been shattered PERIOD Even everyday errands like going to the grocery store or dropping the kids off at school can be uns

ettling or seem pointless PERIOD

Therapists have a name for it PERIOD

 said New York Presbyterian Hospital psychiatrist Alan Manevitz PERIOD 

Acute stress disorder is a clinical description category for a reaction to a traumatic situation that can be physically dangerous or emotionally distressing PERIOD

The symptoms are varied PERIOD You can feel anxious or dazed PERIOD You can be irritable PERIOD Or numb PERIOD You can sleep for hours or you can walk the floor at night PERIOD

What you dont feel like is yourself PERIOD ASD can last days or weeks depending on your exposure to trauma PERIOD

The lengthy rescue and cleanup roundtheclock media coverage and the threat of more terrorist attacks just extends the recovery period therapists say PERIOD

 Manevitz said PERIOD 

For some people the terrorist attacks will result in a more debilitating condition posttraumatic stress disorder a severe delayed reaction to violence or abuse PERIOD

Without therapy sufferers relive terrifying incidents sometimes years later PERIOD Flashbacks can occur on anniversaries of the incident or be triggered by a random reminder such as a whiff of smoke PERIOD

Its more than just  Among posttraumatic stress patients imaging experiments show that certain brain structures such as the hippocampus can shrink PERIOD Brain chemistry also alters after experiencing trauma PERIOD

Survivors who escaped the infernos at the World Trade Center and the Pentagon as well as the first rescuers who watched their companions perish are the most likely to develop posttraumatic stress researchers said PERIOD

How many Previous catastrophes offer some clues PERIOD

In Oklahoma City onethird of the survivors and rescuers suffered posttraumatic stress a Veterans Administration study shows PERIOD

So how can we feel better When will we feel better

Professional counseling may be appropriate for some PERIOD In severe cases drug therapy also relieves anxiety depression and other symptoms about half the time according to Columbia University psychiatrist Randall Marshall PERIOD

But for most of us therapists say Freud offered the right prescription when he identified his twin towers of happiness a century ago PERIOD

Love and work PERIOD

Enjoying the company of others  family neighbors church even a ballgame or a concert  is therapeutic they said PERIOD

Over the weekend Emily Weinstein  dropped by a Manhattan art gallery PERIOD It was her first carefree moment since the attacks PERIOD

 she allowed PERIOD

Talking about the attacks  where you were what you saw and most importantly how you feel  also helps raise the curtain on your spirits PERIOD

 said C PERIOD Donald Williams a Yakima Wash. therapist and president of the Academy of Organizational and Occupational Psychiatry PERIOD

Work is another way to get a grip whether it means returning to your desk or resuming your household schedule PERIOD  Williams said PERIOD

After the attacks New York computer trainer Kim Luisi  decided her job  even if it does not directly defy evil or save lives PERIOD

So she rides the train from Long Island back into Manhattan with thousands of other commuters PERIOD To do her job PERIOD To see people PERIOD To talk PERIOD

 she reminds herself PERIOD
